definition: to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil

sentences.english: You don’t need to keep the extras that are past their prime
sentences.chinese: 你不必保留那些已超過它們全盛期的額外部分。

sentences.english: He has nooned in his writing life.
sentences.chinese: 他已達到他寫作生涯的全盛時期。

sentences.english: FOR many Japanese the boom years are still seared on their memories.
sentences.chinese: 許多日本人心中仍埋藏着全盛時期的美好記憶。

sentences.english: After Sun Yat- sen came Chiang Kai- shek, who brought the Kuomintang' s military power to its zenith.
sentences.chinese: 蔣介石代替孫中山，創造了國民黨的全盛的軍事時代。

sentences.english: The 19th century was the heyday of steam railways.
sentences.chinese: 19世紀是蒸汽火車的全盛時期。

sentences.english: The heyday of the coal market is far from over.
sentences.chinese: 煤炭市場全盛時期的結束還離我們很遠。

sentences.english: Theart of embroidery had its heyday in the Ming and Qing dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 在明朝和清朝，刺繡藝術達到全盛期。

sentences.english: The island is the golden age of Goths rule.
sentences.chinese: 該島的全盛時期是哥特人統治時期。

sentences.english: S. The Middle East-Asia economic relationship is definitely starting to bloom.
sentences.chinese: 中東和亞洲的經濟關係無疑正在走向全盛期。
英國在都鐸王朝時代處於全盛期。

sentences.english: During the heyday of Egypt the sign of Taurus, the Bull, was in the commanding position.
sentences.chinese: 在埃及的全盛期，金牛宮處於統治地位。

sentences.english: Although he is past his prime, he is at the peak of his career.
sentences.chinese: 雖然他已過了他的全盛期，他正在事業的顛峯。

sentences.english: Steam railways had their heyday in the 19th century .
sentences.chinese: 19世紀是蒸汽機車的全盛時期。

sentences.english: Today, human society has entered the times of prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 現代人類社會進入了全盛的時代。

sentences.english: Their heyday lasted from the late 19th to the mid-20th century.
sentences.chinese: 全盛期由19世紀後期延續到20世紀中期。

sentences.english: His reign marked the beginning of the golden age of the Ottoman Empire.
sentences.chinese: 他的統治標誌着奧斯曼帝國全盛時期的開始。

definition: variant of 巔峰|巅峰[dian1 feng1]
to beat comfortably/to win easily/abbr. for 穩操勝券|稳操胜券, to have victory within one's grasp
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
variant of 復原|复原[fu4 yuan2]
